results.baseline: Good morning and welcome to the Loma Negra Third Quarter 2021 Conference Call and Webcast. All participants will be in listen-only mode. Should you need assistance, please signal Conference Specialist by pressing the star key followed by Zero. After today's presentation, there will be an opportunity to ask questions. Also, Mr. Sergio Feifman will be responding in Spanish immediately following an English translation. To ask your question, you may press star, then one on your telephone keypad. To withdraw your question, please press star, then two. Please note that this event is being recorded. I'll now like to turn the conference over to Mr. Diego Halone. By now, everyone should have access to our earnings press release and the presentation for today's call, both of which were distributed yesterday after market close. Joining me on the call this morning will be Sergio Feifman, our CEO and Vice President of the Board of Directors, and our CFO, Marco Gradin. Both of them will be available for the QA session. Before I turn the call over to Sergio, I would like to make the following safe harbour statements. Today's call will contain forward looking statements and I refer you to the forward looking statements section of our earnings release and recent filing with the SEC. We assume no obligation to update or revise any forward looking statements to reflect new or changed events or circumstances. This conference call will also include discussion on non gap financial measures, the full reconciliation to the corresponding financial measures is included in the earnings press release. Now I would like to turn the call over to Sergio. Thank you, Diego. Hello everyone and thank you for joining us today. As usual, I'm going to mention a few highlights of the third quarter and then Marcos will we through our market review and financial results. After that, I will provide some final remark and then we will open the code to your question. As you could see from our release used yesterday, we are pleased to share our third quarter results where we observe solid demand in high historic figures as we keep our core business margin at world class level. We encourage that the strong momentum experience in cement sales since the start of the recovery in mid twenty twenty has reached level almost of the two seen in record industry years. Our high efficient production, standard enabled, as to delivery another robust quarter, despite the impact of the normalization of operation and the subsequent effect of regular stationary maintenance cost and the higher energy input in our assessment EVDA margins. Despite these effects, when measured in US dollar, our assessment EVDA increased to fifty one million, from forty eight million in third quarter twenty twenty, even improving the result from last quarter, keeping the US dollar per ton above thirty dollars. Finally, regarding the expansion project of La Mali, we are delivering cement to the market and already seeing promising result from the first production budget. We expect to show its benefits in the coming quarters. I will now hand off the call to Marco Gradin, who will view through our market review at Financial Results. Please Marcus, go ahead. Thank you, Sergio. Good day everyone. As you can see on slide four, leaving behind the deep drops of GDP in two thousand twenty, we saw a sharp recovery in the second quarter and an improvement in twenty twenty one GDP estimated growth reaching eight point three percent. Construction activity measured by the ISAC also had a strong performance in recent months, starting to present a more moderate growth, as third quarter of Auto 20 showed the start of the post-pandemic recovery. Regarding cement national industry sales, they had kept on growing strongly, even above our previous expectation, consolidated in high figures with ten months accumulated volumes almost reaching industry's year record. Less than 1% down from the same period of 2017. Although we do not see large private infrastructure projects, Bulk has recovered mostly on the back of smaller projects. So when breaking down the consumption by dispatch mode, we absorb figures in line with historical pre-pandemic average. Certainly the economy as a whole still faces different challenges, particularly on the macroeconomic outlook that may impact our future growth expectations. Turning on to slide five for a review of our top line performance by segment. Consolidated revenues increase year on year by eight point five percent, mainly reflecting the continuous recovery of the other segments, more affected by the pandemic restriction and the growth of our core segment business. Cement, masonry cement, and lime segment was up 2.4% with volumes expanding 8.4% with softer pricing dynamic. Concrete and aggregates show sharp revenues recovery of one hundred seventeen percent and forty seven percent year on year, respectively. As we mentioned before, these segments suffer more deeply the effects of the pandemic restrictions. In the case of concrete volume expansion of 111% was underpinned by a positive pricing recovery in performance. Regarding aggregates, the segment volume was up 7.2%, boosted by a recovery in pricing and a positive pricing mix. Finally, railroad revenues increased by 25.4% in this quarter versus the same quarter in 2020enty as the high transported volumes were coupled with a good pricing performance and a positive product mix. Moving on to slide seven. Consolidated gross profit for the quarter slightly declined zero point one percent year on year, with margin contracted by two hundred twenty two basis points, mainly impacted by the dominization of seasonality cost and higher energy inputs. Seven gross margin contracted by five five hundred seventy seven basis points from thirty five point five percent to twenty nine point eight percent, with the comparison affected by regular add on maintenance cost this quarter against the fourth quarter of twenty twenty with a maintenance schedule affected by the pandemic restriction. We also experienced some pressure and from seasonal energy charges as winter production in 2020 was abnormally low due to the sharp drop in the month of last year. For the next year, the brand new line built in La Mali plant will give us the flexibility to maximize production out of the winter months, avoiding higher energy charges. SGNA expenses as a percentage of revenues remain almost flat, decreasing by five basis points to seven point six percent from seven point seven percent, value due to cost illusion from higher sales volume. Please turn to slide eight. Our adjusted DBTA was down nine point one percent in the quarter, reaching four point seven billion pesos we've consolidated the Vita margin contracted by five hundred twelve basis points to twenty-six point four percent, mainly explained by a lower segment segment adjusted the BTA and the impact of the recovery of the other excitement, which as they have lower margins, contributed negatively to the consolidated margin. In a nine-month basis, the Justed BTA margin expanded 55 basis points to 30.7%. When measured in US dollars, our third quarter VITA reached $51 million, up 6.5% from 48 million in the same quarter a year ago, and sequentially. Seminar segment adjusted the BTA margin contracted by four hundred eighty four basis points to twenty nine point five percent, mainly due to the impact of regular seasonality maintenance and winter energy cost, coupled by a softer pricing dynamic, partially offset by the increasing sales volume. In a per-ton basis, a BTA remains at a top notch level of $30. Concrete adjusted ABTA increased $42 million pesos compared to first quarter 20, explained by a recovery in sales volume and a positive price performance, yet margins remained at negative 4.0%. Aggregates adjusted FTA improved sharply from negative sixty-four million pesos in first quarter twenty to one million pesos in first quarter twenty-one, with margin of zero point three percent as better pricing mix and volumes at weighted cost increase. Finally, railroad adjusted BDA improved 34 million pesos to 110 million pesos for the quarter, with margin expansion from 6.3% to seven point three percent main explained by high gate transported volume, positive product mix and good pricing performance. Moving on to the bottom line on slide ten. Our profit before tax stood at two point six billion pesos with the comparison to third quarter twenty, affected by an extraordinary result in such quarter. Total finance cost stood at zero point three billion pesos in third quarter twenty-one compared to a net gain of three point one billion pesos in third quarter twenty, due to an extraordinary result in foreign exchange gain of three point one billion pesos. During that quarter. Guided net monetary position was zero point three billion in first quarter twenty one compared to zero point two billion in first quarter twenty. As a result, our net final expense increased by seventy nine million pesos to zero point three billion compared to the same quarter of last year, driven by lower effects depreciation effect compared to the evolution of the inflation rate. Finally, during the quarter, we recognize a non-cash impairment of Sierras Valle's asset facility of 131 million pesos due to its obsolescence and the future higher efficient production scheme of Loma. Moving on to the balance sheet, as you can see on slide eleven, we ended the quarter with a cash position of four point three billion pesos and a total debt of four point zero billion pesos. Consequently our net debt JA ratio stood at minus zero point zero two times compared to zero point sixteen times at the end of twenty twenty. In Faircore twenty one, we reduce our debt in sixteen million US dollars, standing at forty million, eighty three percent of which is denominated in US dollars. Additionally, as we continue with our third share repurchase program, we acquire share for a total amount of 600 million pesos in the quarter. Our operating cash generation stood at 5.4 billion pesos with a positive seasonal working capital effect. Regarding capital expenditures, we spent one point five billion pesos, of which were dedicated to the Mali expansion project. As the second line is already delivered cement, the capital requirements are almost completed. Now for our final remarks I would like to handle the call back to Sergio. Thank you, Marcos. Now to finalize the presentation, I please ask you to turn to slide thirteen. To wrap up, I would like to highlight the strong evolution of the cement demand. With accumulate volume until October almost reaching industry record. Even through, we expect this trend to continue in the forthcoming quarter, with remain caution through the medium term, as Argentine faced macroeconomic and political challenges that could affect the evolution of the economic activity. Regarding our new line at La Mali, we are glad about the advance in the project as we are already delivering cement to the market. We are enthusiastic with the preliminary results and expect to start seeing the operational efficiency and economic benefit in future quarters. Furthermore, this additional capacity will allow us to minimize production in winter, avoiding the sessionally higher energy impact. and also reducing the need for solid fuel that leads to a more environmentally friendly energy matrix. Natural gas will remain our main source of thermal energy. We continue to work analyzing alternatives for the near future to support a sustainable growth path for Loma Negre, underpinned by our highly efficient operation, standard and solid capital structure. Last but not least, I would like to thank all our people and stakeholders for the commitment to Loma Negra operational excellence, without whom this set of solid results would have been much harder to achieve. If you would like to ask a question, please press star, then one on your telephone keypad. A confirmation tone will indicate that your line is in the question queue. You may press star, then two if you would like to remove your line. For participants using speaker equipment, it may be necessary to pick up your handset prior to pressing the keys. Once again, star one on your telephone keypad. We would also like to ask that you please limit your questions to one question and one follow up, please. If you have additional questions, you may re enter the queue for those questions and they will be addressed. Please note that Mr. Sergio Feifman will be responding in Spanish immediately following. Our first question today comes from Alejandra O'Bregon with Morgan Stanley. Please go ahead. Hi, good morning, Lomanegatin. Thank you for taking my question. Congratulations on the results. Um I have two questions. I'll I'll ask the first uh I was just wondering if you can comment please on the different trends that you're seeing across the different verticals residential, infrastructure, uh formal and informal housing, if you can help us understand how that's developing as we go into the into twenty twenty two. Thank you. Speakers, you may have yourself on mute. Hi Alejandra, thank you for the question. Eh en cuanto a la tendencia para el próximo año, eh, estamos viendo en So regarding the trends for next year, we are observing similar levels with moderate growth. muchos anuncios en obras de infraestructura que están próximos a salir y que todavía no están en marcha. So uh for the uh therefore for the next month we are uh optimistic uh regarding the housing uh demand, uh residential demand y comenzara salida infrastructure. And to start some uh infrastructure projects which has been approved uh to start ramping up uh in the next future. Thank you. I was just wondering if you can comment uh on whether the quarry is supplying limestone normally to Loma Negra and and if you have seen any stop of supply of our materials in the in the area or whether this is just operating at at a normal capacity. Thank you. El conflicto puntual de Ahoma fue con el con nuestro proveedor de la cantera de Olavarría. So the conflict in Olavarria with with Fueron por una diferencia menores de de criterios los cuales fueron solucionados. uh it was regarding a a small difference of criteria which has been solved already uh n no es este ilógico pensar que que puede haber otros conflictos pero le la compañía está está preparada para poder soportar esos prepared to to to deal with this kind of conflicts uh más allá de la parada de los hornos por por dos o tres días no no hemos perdido una tonelada de venta en ninguno de los conflictos que hemos tenido en Olavarrillo. So we besides the the stop of of of our production for around three days, we we did not have any other impact on in the Olabarrilla plant. Thank you very much. This was very clear. I would like to turn the conference back over to Diego Halone for closing remarks. Thank you for joining us today. We appreciate your participation and interest in our company. We look forward to meeting you again in our next call the coming quarter. In the meantime, the the team remains available to any questions that you may have. Thank you. The conference has now concluded. Thank you for attending today's presentation. You may now disconnect. The conference has now concluded. Thank you for attending today's presentation. In the case of concrete volume expansion of 111% was underpinned by a positive pricing recovery in performance. Regarding aggregates, the segment volume was up 7.2%, boosted by a recovery in pricing and a positive pricing mix. Finally, railroad revenues increased by 25.4% in this quarter versus the same quarter in 2020enty as the high transported volumes were coupled with a good pricing performance and a positive product mix. Moving on to slide seven. Consolidated gross profit for the quarter slightly declined zero point one percent year on year, with margin contracted by two hundred twenty two basis points, mainly impacted by the dominization of seasonality cost and higher energy inputs. Seven gross margin contracted by five five hundred seventy seven basis points from thirty five point five percent to twenty nine point eight percent, with the comparison affected by regular add on maintenance cost this quarter against the fourth quarter of twenty twenty with a maintenance schedule affected by the pandemic restriction. We also experienced some pressure and from seasonal energy charges as winter production in 2020 was abnormally low due to the sharp drop in the month of last year. For the next year, the brand new line built in La Mali plant will give us the flexibility to maximize production out of the winter months, avoiding higher energy charges. SGNA expenses as a percentage of revenues remain almost flat, decreasing by five basis points to seven point six percent from seven point seven percent, value due to cost illusion from higher sales volume. Please turn to slide eight. Our adjusted DBTA was down nine point one percent in the quarter, reaching four point seven billion pesos we've consolidated the Vita margin contracted by five hundred twelve basis points to twenty-six point four percent, mainly explained by a lower segment segment adjusted the BTA and the impact of the recovery of the other excitement, which as they have lower margins, contributed negatively to the consolidated margin. In a nine-month basis, the Justed BTA margin expanded 55 basis points to 30.7%. When measured in US dollars, our third quarter VITA reached $51 million, up 6.5% from 48 million in the same quarter a year ago, and sequentially. Seminar segment adjusted the BTA margin contracted by four hundred eighty four basis points to twenty nine point five percent, mainly due to the impact of regular seasonality maintenance and winter energy cost, coupled by a softer pricing dynamic, partially offset by the increasing sales volume. In a per-ton basis, a BTA remains at a top notch level of $30. Concrete adjusted ABTA increased $42 million pesos compared to first quarter 20, explained by a recovery in sales volume and a positive price performance, yet margins remained at negative 4.0%. Aggregates adjusted FTA improved sharply from negative sixty-four million pesos in first quarter twenty to one million pesos in first quarter twenty-one, with margin of zero point three percent as better pricing mix and volumes at weighted cost increase. Finally, railroad adjusted BDA improved 34 million pesos to 110 million pesos for the quarter, with margin expansion from 6.3% to seven point three percent main explained by high gate transported volume, positive product mix and good pricing performance. Moving on to the bottom line on slide ten. Our profit before tax stood at two point six billion pesos with the comparison to third quarter twenty, affected by an extraordinary result in such quarter. Total finance cost stood at zero point three billion pesos in third quarter twenty-one compared to a net gain of three point one billion pesos in third quarter twenty, due to an extraordinary result in foreign exchange gain of three point one billion pesos. During that quarter. Guided net monetary position was zero point three billion in first quarter twenty one compared to zero point two billion in first quarter twenty. As a result, our net final expense increased by seventy nine million pesos to zero point three billion compared to the same quarter of last year, driven by lower effects depreciation effect compared to the evolution of the inflation rate. Finally, during the quarter, we recognize a non-cash impairment of Sierras Valle's asset facility of 131 million pesos due to its obsolescence and the future higher efficient production scheme of Loma. Moving on to the balance sheet, as you can see on slide eleven, we ended the quarter with a cash position of four point three billion pesos and a total debt of four point zero billion pesos. Consequently our net debt JA ratio stood at minus zero point zero two times compared to zero point sixteen times at the end of twenty twenty. In Faircore twenty one, we reduce our debt in sixteen million US dollars, standing at forty million, eighty three percent of which is denominated in US dollars. Additionally, as we continue with our third share repurchase program, we acquire share for a total amount of 600 million pesos in the quarter. Our operating cash generation stood at 5.4 billion pesos with a positive seasonal working capital effect. Regarding capital expenditures, we spent one point five billion pesos, of which were dedicated to the Mali expansion project. As the second line is already delivered cement, the capital requirements are almost completed. Now for our final remarks I would like to handle the call back to Sergio. Thank you, Marcos. Now to finalize the presentation, I please ask you to turn to slide thirteen. To wrap up, I would like to highlight the strong evolution of the cement demand. With accumulate volume until October almost reaching industry record. Even through, we expect this trend to continue in the forthcoming quarter, with remain caution through the medium term, as Argentine faced macroeconomic and political challenges that could affect the evolution of the economic activity. Regarding our new line at La Mali, we are glad about the advance in the project as we are already delivering cement to the market. We are enthusiastic with the preliminary results and expect to start seeing the operational efficiency and economic benefit in future quarters. Furthermore, this additional capacity will allow us to minimize production in winter, avoiding the sessionally higher energy impact. and also reducing the need for solid fuel that leads to a more environmentally friendly energy matrix. Natural gas will remain our main source of thermal energy. We continue to work analyzing alternatives for the near future to support a sustainable growth path for Loma Negre, underpinned by our highly efficient operation, standard and solid capital structure. Last but not least, I would like to thank all our people and stakeholders for the commitment to Loma Negra operational excellence, without whom this set of solid results would have been much harder to achieve. We are now ready to take your question. Operator, please open the call for question. Thank you. We will now conduct a question and answer session. If you would like to ask a question, please press star, then one on your telephone keypad. A confirmation tone will indicate that your line is in the question queue. You may press star, then two if you would like to remove your line. For participants using speaker equipment, it may be necessary to pick up your handset prior to pressing the keys. Once again, star one on your telephone keypad. We would also like to ask that you please limit your questions to one question and one follow up, please. If you have additional questions, you may re enter the queue for those questions and they will be addressed. Please note that Mr. Sergio Feifman will be responding in Spanish immediately following. Um I have two questions. I'll I'll ask the first uh I was just wondering if you can comment please on the different trends that you're seeing across the different verticals residential, infrastructure, uh formal and informal housing, if you can help us understand how that's developing as we go into the into twenty twenty two. Thank you. Speakers, you may have yourself on mute. Hi Alejandra, thank you for the question. Eh en cuanto a la tendencia para el próximo año, eh, estamos viendo en So regarding the trends for next year, we are observing similar levels with moderate growth. muchos anuncios en obras de infraestructura que están próximos a salir y que todavía no están en marcha. And to start some uh infrastructure projects which has been approved uh to start ramping up uh in the next future. Thank you. So the conflict in Olavarria with with Fueron por una diferencia menores de de criterios los cuales fueron solucionados. uh it was regarding a a small difference of criteria which has been solved already uh n no es este ilógico pensar que que puede haber otros conflictos pero le la compañía está está preparada para poder soportar esos prepared to to to deal with this kind of conflicts uh más allá de la parada de los hornos por por dos o tres días no no hemos perdido una tonelada de venta en ninguno de los conflictos que hemos tenido en Olavarrillo. So we besides the the stop of of of our production for around three days, we we did not have any other impact on in the Olabarrilla plant. Thank you very much. This was very clear. Ladies and gentlemen, at this time there, are no further questions. So this will conclude our question and answer session. I would like to turn the conference back over to Diego Halone for closing remarks. Thank you for joining us today. We appreciate your participation and interest in our company. We look forward to meeting you again in our next call the coming quarter. In the meantime, the the team remains available to any questions that you may have. Thank you. The conference has now concluded. Thank you for attending today's presentation. You may now disconnect. The conference has now concluded. Thank you for attending today's presentation. We have in this year we are budgeting and we are seeing better prices than last year and higher margins compared to last year, having some bigger input costs in some like fertilizers much more bigger, but margins since comparing this year to last year are a little higher. We related to the real estate business, so remembering that we have three lines of businesses. One is the production size and the yields on the production, the second is the real estate, and the third the services in agriculture. A lot of sales in there and a lot of liquidities in in Brazil related to the real estate business. About our segment through IRSA, the urban segment, it's recovering a lot. This quarter was all open. Related to the quarter of production, we were driven by the sugarcane activity. In here the that activity gave us much better results and was mainly explained by the the frozen that the country received in the winter that made a big loss in the southern regions of of Brazil and that made an increase a very important increase in the sugar cane prices, combined with the the oil prices incor increased, so the combination of the two made a big jump in the prices of the ethanol and the sugar cane, and in our case our plantations were in regions that they were not affected in production. So that combination made us a big gain, and in the others a good quarter too. Okay, thank you Alejandro. Um move to the slide number three about the spectral planted area. In relation about that, we can see observed in the graph how prices probably went up to reaching reaching their tops in June of twenty twenty one, about soybean sixty four percent and corn one hundred and thirteen percent. However, along the following five months there was a moderate correction in the prices, dropping seventeen percent in soybean and twenty five percent thirty three percent in corn. Now the current regional head positions uh is uh in in in prices similar to budget, is in soybeans si uh five fifty six percent and in con 51% and similar prices to the budget. About climate condition and showing process. As shown in the bottom right of the graph, the climate condition in Argentina and Brazil had a recovery in comparison to the dry season of the last year. Currently, the forecast marked neutrality as the Nina moved away. Regarding the current showing process in November twenty twenty one, the total soybean is twenty three percent, Bolivia sixty four percent, Brazil forty percent, and Argentina two percent. Total in corn is thirteen percent, Bolivia ninety nine percent, Brazil thirty percent, and Argentina twelve percent. And the last one in wheat, we have a hundred percent of the planting because now we are just starting to have us in Argentina. Thank you everybody. When we go to the next page we can see what happened in the farmland cells and these two operational transactions were done in Brazil. So give us the re the the reevaluation of the land in Brazil. This is a transaction that will be recognised in two steps. So this is a uh a big transaction, uh giving us a big gain for this year and for the twenty four twenty twenty four two. And internal rate of return, this farm we bought in two thousand and seven, if I don't remember uh incorrectly. So a a long story giving us a like twenty percent in real or twelve percent in dollars, a big gain. And again when we see a farm at a three percent return, we sell it and we begin to invest it in another area or in another activity. So first semester or first quarter with activity in Brazil, but still not reflected in our balance sheets. We can move now to page number six. Um we would like to every quarter to be mentioning some of what our agricultural services are doing. Here in this page we are reflecting the two FIO and Aglofy. FIO, where Cresut Ra owns fifty And let's see what is the commercialization status. This company became the first of the country by far. Commercializing grains inputs, uh futures and options, services. So this company that today this year surpassed six point four percent and we can see the breakdown of uh what is our participation on the on the on the corn, wheat and soybeans, this company became by more than two million tons bigger than the competitors and this is making really a big gain. The E EBT evolution, we see that uh we are achieving close to fifteen million dollars record of the company coming five, six years ago, close to break even. So this company is becoming relevant to Cresut. And to give an idea of this company that has close to zero debt went to the market and raised twelve. three million dollars at a zero interest rate through the local capital capital market in two years period. So this will be for investment in fixed asset and working capital. But this company is mainly employees. This year is passing more employees than Cresud. FIO is close to three hundred employees. Cresud Agriculture in Argentina is something like that. This company is is pure services to farmers from the inputs to the exports for the commodities and the specialities. This company is growing not only in Argentina, beginning its expansion in the region, going in the inputs to the rest of South America, in the output it's beginning in Brazil through FIO in Brazil. So this companies begin to be very relevant to our strategy. And on the other side in the right, we can see the evolution of AgroFi where Cresut stake is twenty percent. AgroFi expanding not only to Argentina but to Uruguay, Brazil, Bolivia, Paraguay, Chile and going to Colombia. So growing in revenues, growing the last year in eighty seven percent, beginning the first transaction of farmers in the this is the e commerce for the agriculture business and this is the big leading company in the region with annual basis of thirty one million per participants, with a lot of monthly contacts, finishing a capital raise these days, raising more capital to expand its mission, so this is becoming the marketplace of the agriculture business. So the two growing a lot in the whole region. We are seeing much more results of Result through these two companies. I will introduce now Mr Mattia. Thank you Alejandro, good morning everyone. If we move to page seven, we can see the different performance of our segments in the urban side through our participation in ERSA. Our shopping malls we are happy that for the first time in the last one year and a half we are running without restrictions. The uh all the pandemic restrictions uh were clear by the government, so now we can run on a normal uh on a normal operation. We can see that after the effect of the pandemic we have an occupancy of almost ninety percent if we leave aside the effect of Falavela that left the country, we have ninety four point three percent. The occupancy is growing quarter by quarter, so we expect to have better numbers going. forward When we see the real sales, of course when we compare with the previous year that the operation was closed, we see a ridiculous number, three hundred and twenty two percent above last year. When we compare with pre-pandemic levels, we see a real decrease of ten point seven percent. So we hope to see better numbers going forward as well. In the case of the offices, we remain with the same size of the portfolio, uh size of the portfolio with one hundred and fourteen thousand square meters. After selling some properties and with the inauguration of Catalina's building that we did during the December last year. Um the occupancy is at levels of seventy-eight point nine percent. The average rent per square meter remains stable at levels of twenty-five dollars per square meter. We see that the companies are are coming back to the offices with a hybrid modality, but our operations never close in the office portfolio. After the closing of the quarter, we announced uh a new sale of some floors at the two hundred and sixty one de la paulera building. We sold three floors for thirty two million dollars uh that we already collected all the proceeds and we are using that money to reduce the leverage of the company. Regarding the hotels, the frontiers of Argentina just opened for foreigners in November. So the hotels in the in the city of Buenos Aires were really affected by this situation. In the south of the country, since the locals are are traveling around the country. The operation in Shaoshao was very good, and we hope to see the recovery in the city of Buenos Aires going forward. One important announcement on IRSA side was the announcement of the merge or the proposal of the merge between IRSA Commercial Properties and IRSA that was announced in September. We just call for the shareholders meeting that that will take place on december the twenty two. So after this if they are if the merge is approved, Cresut will reduce the stake in IRSA from fifty s sorry, from sixty two percent to fifty four percent. This is because we will issue shares for minority shareholders of IRSA commercial properties and we will give ERSA shares. Going to the our balance sheet and the results of the quarter in page nine, we can see that we are finishing the quarter with a gain of EUR two point eight billion compared with eleven point four billion last year, attributable to our controlling interest is two billion pesos against four point four billion pesos last year. We have here several different drivers. If we see on the left side in the agri business we have uh results that are in line with the previous year. We are finishing with an operating income of two point almost two point three billion pesos and it's the the same number last year and we will see more details in the in the next page, in the urban business we are showing a loss of four point six billion against an important gain of thirty five point one billion pesos. Last year this is related to the change in the fur value. If you see in the line six, there you have the results that last year we posted again of thirty six billion pesos and this year a loss of six point four billion pesos. This is related to the macroeconomic drivers of Argentina. We are valuing our properties basically at dollar terms similar with the previous quarter, but when we convert that into pesos and then compare with inflation, inflation was at levels of nine percent during the quarter and the evaluation of the official exchange rate was only three percent or or the blue chip swap was seven percent, so that effect generates losses in pesos term in the in the balance sheet. So we can move to the next page, page ten, that here we have the breakdown of the adjusted the data by segment, we can see very good results on the agribusiness. The main difference with the previous year was the sugarcane line, line four, that this is related to better prices and better production, so in also adjusted by inflation we have a much better gain than the previous year and then in the rest of the land lines we are similar with the previous year. The first quarter is not the most relevant quarter for grains. So we will see the results going forward. In the cattle we have the effect of the inflation that prices adjusted lower than inflation, so we are recognising a loss here, but after the quarter we see a an increase in prices, so maybe we will recover in the in the following quarter. And the results of FIO, as Alejandro mentioned, that was very good result, so we we keep increasing uh the VITA of of that segment. Regarding farmland sales, all the disposals that Alejandro mentioned will be recognised in the balance sheet probably in the next quarter, part will be in steps, but we will see better results going forward. In the previous year we we have again related to the receivables, some some farms that we sold are payable at packs of soybean, so we last year because of the increasing prices we see a recovery in that line and that that doesn't happen this quarter. Regarding the urban segment, here it's more difficult to compare. We are we are comparing with an operation in the malls that was closed with uh uh during the previous year. So here you can see that last year we posted a loss. This year we are recovering with almost normal operation in terms of revenues. We will have some concessions but going forward that uh that will disappear. So we are r now running with a complete normal operation. In the case of the offices we see a stable result. Here we have different different drivers on on increasing square meters because of the La Paluera and some that we decrease because of the disposals of two buildings. And the hotels we start to see again positive numbers and sales and development during the corridor was no significant transactions. In page eleven we see the other important effect that we have in the financial statement, we have a net financial results of three billion pesos positive against a loss last year of three point nine billion pesos of lost. The reason here is basically the effects. When we see last year we have a real devaluation of zero point four percent or a nominal devaluation of eight point one percent and this quarter we have a nominal devaluation of three point two and appreciation in real terms of five point six percent that generate that when we value our debt in dollars into pesos, we are recognizing again that is in the line two in the next exchange differences. Finally, in page twelve we have the breakdown and the debt amortization schedule that remain stable compared with the previous quarter. What we did during the quarter was to issue around sixty million dollars in the local market through two different transactions. One was related to the central bank regulation that forced companies to refinance part of the debt in order to have access to buy dollars. So we did a transaction very successful in july twenty twenty one. And then in September twenty one we issue forty one point eight million dollars to refinance uh a bond that that expired in December at three point five percent interest rate that will exp will with a maturity in September twenty twenty four. So uh last week we also announced that related to our bond that expire in december twenty one, the fifth fifty three point six million dollars. We called that bond uh in advance, so we will cancel this week all the amount in order to reduce our exposure to dollars and also to reduce the leverage. So with this we finished the formal presentation. Now we open the line to receive your questions. Thank you very much. If there is a question, you can use the chat or raise hands. If there are no questions, we conclude this presentation and we turn back to Mr. Alejandro Elstein, CEO, for his closing remarks. We are beginning a very good season, big size regionally, uh having capital for buying more land in the region too, after the capital increases that we did last year and we are growing uh so we think that it's a very good momentum for agriculture on the region. Uh prices are in much better terms than in the past and uh margins are much higher. So we expect a very good season and in the combination of real estate having closed in the first quarter two big transactions give us a big uh uh really very good forecast of the annual re result for the agricultural business for the region. And in the case of the services, in the two cases, in the FIO and in the Agrify, having the capital and the group in the sa in the case of AgroFi it's a team of more than three hundred employees too. So we have the challenge of developing that e commerce on the region. So really we are very optimistic on the twenty one, twenty two numbers. So I would like to thank you everyone and deserving to everyone have a very good week. Thank you very much.

results.baseline: Thank you for standing by and welcome to the Evolution Mining December 2021 Quarter Results Call. All participants are in a listen-only mode. There will be a presentation followed by a question and answer session. If you wish to ask a question, you will need to press the star key followed by the number one on your telephone keypad. I would now like to hand the conference over to Mr. Martin Cummings, General Manager of Investor Relations. Please go ahead. Thank you, Darcy. Good morning and welcome to the Evolution Mining December 2021 Quarterly Conference Call. As Darcy mentioned, my name's Martin Cummings and I'm the General Manager Investor Relations. This morning on the call we have Jake Klein, our Executive Chairman, Laurie Conway, our CFO and Finance Director, and myself in our Group Office in Sydney. Bob Fulker, our Chief Chief Operating Officer, and Glenn Masterman, our VP Discovery and Business Development, are dialing in. It has been a tumultuous couple of years and has expected, gold's role as a safe haven during those times has been demonstrated. As the pandemic was breaking in early 2020, we saw gold rise from the low of fifteen hundreds per ounce to an all-time high around twenty seventy in August that year. We started twenty twenty one with the gold price down from its peak at just under US nineteen hundred per ounce. The economies were surging as they emerged from COVID lockdowns and equity markets were printing new highs. Bitcoin was continuing to generate a lot of interest, with some touting it as a new digital gold. And exposure to any metal that ended up in a Tesla was highly sought after. Gold couldn't catch a bit in early twenty twenty one and the sell off was brisk, down to sixteen eighty by March. Gold equities would follow, and by the end of September the G D X index of senior gold companies had fallen about twenty percent year to date, with the GDXJ junior index even lower, down around thirty percent. But in the last three months things have turned. Developing economies are now dealing with soaring inflation, with the Federal Reserve now indicating it will need to respond with rate increases soon. The Omicron COVID variant spread quickly, leading some countries to reintroduce or extend lockdowns and restrictions. And recently Russia and Ukraine tension has Europe on high alert. Bitcoin had an incredible journey in 2021, but has now given back most of those gains. Gold's role as a safe haven is returning and we now trade back up around US eighteen twenty per ounce. For Australian gold miners, the Australian gold dollar gold price also went on a wild ride, but we currently sit within ten to fifteen percent of its all time high. These really are great prices to be selling our product at. And of course copper had a standout year two, rising around twenty five percent. Evolution is well placed to benefit from this with our copper production materially increasing from this month. With that, I'll now hand over to Jake to introduce the December twenty twenty one quarterly report. Thanks Martin. Good morning everyone. Welcome to the call. Thanks for joining us and happy New Year. Despite the industry headwinds, COVID, labor shortages, and unseasonal rainfall, our teams did extremely well to manage the impact. As planned and first articulated to you in July, we anticipate the second half of the year to be materially better than the last six months and are on track to deliver our guidance. Given the first half performance at Red Lake, we expect to be in the bottom half of the production range and between the mid and top end of the cost guidance range. Last quarter, our portfolio was significantly improved by securing one hundred percent ownership of the iconic Ernest Henry Copper Gold Mine. We also concluded the sale of Mount Cardin to Navarre Minerals and whilst retaining exposure to the future of the operation, the sale allows us to focus on our larger, higher margin assets. We continue to be consistent and diligent in the implementation of our strategy of improving the quality of our portfolio and being laser focused about putting ourselves into a position where we can generate sector leading returns on the capital we deploy. In our view, this is the holy grail in our industry and is the true measure of a gold company's performance over the long term. I visited Ernest Henry last week and left very confident that in the December quarter we concluded what is likely to prove one of the most transformative deals in evolution's history. It is an outstanding operation with a great team and terrific geological upside. We look forward to hosting a number of you there for a site visit in due course. The foundations for the transaction were put in place in twenty sixteen when we secured the economic interest in the asset, and since then have built a strong and mutually respectful relationship with Glencore that allowed us to negotiate this deal on a bilateral exclusive basis over the course of a few months last year. Our economic interest delivered seventy nine point five million dollars in cash flow last quarter, and now with one hundred percent of the operation being included from one January, we expect its impact to be even bigger going forward. The CAVE extension pre feasibility study will be a priority, and with intersections four hundred meters below the study area and still open below that, Ernest Henry has a long and very exciting future. Cal performed extremely well and managed to deliver to plan in spite of unprecedented rainfall and COVID interruptions. The Underground Project, which will grow cows production to 350,000 ounces per annum, remains on schedule and budget. I was also fortunate to be able to visit Red Lake in November last year. Due to COVID travel restrictions, this was my first visit since we took ownership of the asset in April 2020. Red Lake is one of the best commercial opportunities I've seen in the gold sector in my career. For the combined purchase price of six hundred and fifty million US dollars, being Red Lake and Battle North, we have secured a district scale tenement tenement position with eleven million ounces of resource and significant exploration upside, seven kilometers of prospective strike with associated mining infrastructure, three mils and $700 million of Canadian tax losses. In time, this asset will be transformed into plus $350,000 ounce a year low-cost producer. This is how values created in our sector. As you will hear from Bob, who has just returned from his third visit in the last five months, progress is being made. Last quarter we, consistently achieved over twelve hundred meters of development each month. As a result of this and other improvements, we are confident of a material and sustainable improvement to production in the next two quarters. We expect this higher production to drive the cost per ounce lower, and I'm looking forward to visiting the operation again with Laurie in the next few weeks. Frustratingly, Mungari remains the only asset in our portfolio that we cann can onot currently visit. We are fortunate to have a good team in Western Australia, have led the Kandana integration, which has gone well, and we are growing increasingly confident about the future and the potential of this operation. Mount Rawdon was impacted by heavy rainfall and was forced to process the low-grade stockpile material. Strategically, we continue to assess the potential of Mount Rawdon to be converted into a pumped hydrogener, which could be a significant contributor of renewable energy to the Southeast Queensland grid at the end of its mine life. This last quarter, the highlights for the discovery team were good intersections at Kew in Western Australia, and also more intriguing and exciting intersections at Red Lake, where there is plenty of open space and interesting geology to discover another high-grade zone. Gwen and his team are also plotting and planning the next phase of drilling at Ernest Henry. Whilst we are managing industry headwinds, we should not ignore the significant commodity price tailwinds. A gold price of over twenty five hundred Australian dollars and a copper price, which going forward will represent around twenty percent of our revenue of over thirteen and a half thousand Australian dollars per tonne. Evolution is well positioned to benefit from this. I'll now hand over to Bob to provide some more detail on the operational performance. Thanks, Jake, and uh good morning everyone. The December quarter saw our drift stabilise at nine point four, the highlight being a thirty five percent reduction in the twelve month moving average at Mungari. The December quarter gold production is the first reported without Mount Carlton's contribution. The quarter's gold production was 148,000 ounces, with a 5% improvement in the oil and sustaining cost to $1,347 an ounce. Despite the challenges faced with above average rainfall and COVID, Cal had a strong quarter delivering 60,000 ounces at an all-insustained cost of $998 an ounce and an operating mine cash flow pre-capital of $80.6 million. Capital investment ramped up at Cal, with sixty million spent on major projects this quarter. This included twenty-four million on the IWL and thirty-three point five million on the underground development. Underground development rates will ramp up in the March quarter with a second jumbo commencing in December, and the selection of the primary mining contractor is on track for the March quarter. The project remains on budget and on schedule. The RWR stage two deposition has run smoothly throughout the quarter. Ernest Henry produced 21,000 ounces of gold and four point one thousand ounces of copper at an all-insustaining cost of a negative eight hundred and eighty two dollars an ounce. The higher AISC compared to the September quarter is primarily driven, primarily driven by lower copper production due to lower mining planned uh lower planned mining tons. The net mine cash flow remains strong at seventy nine point.5 million, another significant contribution to the portfolio. I'm pleased to say this will be the last quarter reporting Ernest Henry as an economic interest. Integration activities are well underway, and I'm excited to have Er thenest Henry team as part of the Evolution family. The pre-feasibility study for the mine extension below the 1125 RL has commenced and will incorporate the recent drilling results indicating mineralization extends further than assumed in the concept study. Completion of the study is expected in H1 FY23. Moving on to Red Lake, over the past five months I've been on site three times. Each time I see an improvement and step change in performance and develop and delivery. Although still work in progress, pleasingly many key metrics are moving in the right direction. Red Lake produced 20,000 ounces for the quarter, and although their all-in-sustaining cost is not where we need it to be, the operating mine cash flow for the quarter was a positive. results.reference: Thank you for standing by and welcome to the Evolution Mining December, 2021 quarter results call. All participants are in a listen only mode. There will be a presentation followed by a question and answer session. If you wish to ask a question, you will need to press the star key followed by the number one on your telephone keypad. I would now like to hand the conference over to Mr. Martin Cummings, general manager of investor relations. Please go ahead. Thank you Darcy. Good morning. And welcome to the Evolution Mining December, 2021 quarterly conference call. As Darcy mentioned, my name's Martin Cummings and I'm the general manager investor relations. This morning on the call we have Jake Klein, our executive chairman, Lawrie Conway, our CFO and finance director, and myself in our group office in Sydney. Bob Fulker, our chief op- chief operating officer and Glen Masterman, our VP discovery and business development are dialing in. It has been in a tumultuous couple of years and as expected, gold's role as a safe haven during those times has been demonstrated. As the pandemic was breaking in early 2020, we saw gold rise from the low of 1500s per ounce to an all time high around 2070 in August that year. We started 2021 with the gold price down from its peak at just under US 1900 per ounce. Economies were surging as they emerged from COVID lockdowns and equity markets were printing new highs. Bitcoin was continuing to generate a lot of interest with some touting it as a new digital gold. An exposure to any metal that ended up in a Tesla was highly sought after. Gold couldn't catch a bid in early 2021 and the sell off was brisk down to 1680 by March. Gold equities would follow, and by the end of September, the GDX index of senior gold companies had fallen about 20% year to date, with the GDXJ junior index even lower, down around 30%. But in the last three months, things have turned. Developing economies are now dealing with soaring inflation with the Federal Reserve now indicating it will need to respond with rate increases soon. The Omicron COVID variance spread quickly, leading some countries to reintroduce or extend lockdowns and restrictions. And recently Russia and Ukraine intention has Europe on high alert. Bitcoin had an incredible journey in 2021, but has now given back most of those gains. Gold's role as a safe haven is returning and we now trade back up around US 1820 per ounce. For Australian gold miners, the Australian gold dollar gold price also went on a wild ride, but we currently sit within 10 to 15% of its all time high. These really are great prices to be selling our product at. And of course, copper had a standout year too rising around 25%. Evolution is well placed to benefit from this with our copper production materially increasing from this month. With that, I'll now hand over to Jake to introduce the December, 2021 quarterly report. Thanks Martin. Good morning, everyone. Welcome to the call. Thanks for joining us and happy new year. Despite the industry headwinds, COVID, labor shortages and unseasonal rainfall, our teams did extremely well to manage the impact. As planned and first articulated to you in July, we anticipate the second half of the year to be materially better than the last six months and are on track to deliver our guidance. Given the first half performance at Red Lake, we expect to be in the bottom half of the production range in between the mid and top end of the cost guidance range. Last quarter, our portfolio was significantly improved by securing 100% ownership of the iconic Ernest Henry copper-gold mine. We also concluded the sale of Mount Carlton and Navarre Minerals, and whilst retaining exposure to the future of the operation, the sale allows us to focus in our larger, higher margin assets. We continue to be consistent and diligent in the implementation of our strategy of improving the quality of our portfolio, and being laser focus about putting ourselves into a position where we can generate sector leading returns on the capital we deploy. In our view, this is the holy grail in our industry and is the true measure of a gold company's performance over the long term. I visited Ernest Henry last week and left very confident that in the December quarter we concluded what is likely to prove one of the most transformative deals in Evolution's history. It is an outstanding operation with a great team and terrific geological upside. We look forward to hosting a number of you there for a site visit in due course. The foundations for the transaction were put in place in 2016 when we secured the economic interest in the assets. And since then it built a strong and mutually respectful relationship with Glencore that allowed us to negotiate this deal on a bilateral exclusive basis over the course of, of a few months last year. Our economic interest delivered 79.5 million in cash flow last quarter. And now with 100% of the operation being included from one January, we expect its impact to be even bigger going forward. The cave extension prefeasibility study will be a priority, and with intersections 400 meters below the study area and still open below that, Ernest Henry has a long and very exciting future. Carl performed extremely well and managed to deliver to plan in spite of unprecedented rainfall and, and COVID interruptions. The underground project which will grow Carl's production to 350,000 ounces per annum remains on schedule and budget. I was also fortunate to be able to visit Red Lake in November last year. Due to COVID travel restrictions, this was my first visit since we took ownership of the asset in April, 2020. Red Lake is one of the best commercial opportunities I've seen in the gold sector in my career. For the combined purchase price of $650 million being Red Lake and Battle North, we have secured a district scale tenem- tenement position with 11 million ounce of resource and significant exploration upside, seven kilometers of prospective strike with associated mining infrastructure, three mills and $700 million of Canadian tax losses. In time, this asset will be transformed into plus 350,000 ounce a year low cost producer. This is our values created in our sector. As you will hear from Bob, who has just returned from his third visit in the last five months, progress is being made. Last quarter we consistently achieved over 1200 meters of development each month. And as a result of this and other improvements, we have confidence of a material and sustainable improvement to production in the next two quarters. We expect this higher production to drive the cost per ounce lower, and I'm looking forward to visiting the operation again with Lawrie in the next few weeks. Frustratingly Mungari remains the only asset in our portfolio that we cannot, cannot currently visit. We are fortunate to have a good team in Western Australia who've led the Kundana integration, which has gone well. And we are growing increasingly confident about the future and the potential of this operation. Mt. Rawdon was impacted by heavy rainfall and was forced to process low, the low grade stock power material. Strategically we continue to assess the potential of Mt. Rawdon to be converted into pumped hydro generator, which could be a significant contributor of renewable energy to the Southeast Queensland grid at the end of its mine life. This last quarter, the highlights for the discovery team were good intersections at Q and Western Australia, and also more intriguing and exciting intersections at Red Lake where there is plenty of open space and interesting geology to discover another high grade zone. Glen and his team are also plotting and planning the next phase of drilling at Earnest Henry. Whilst we are managing industry headwinds, we should not ignore the significant commodity price tailwinds. A gold price of over A$ 2,500 and a copper price, which going forward will represent around 20% of our revenue of over A$ 13,500 per ton. Evolution is well positioned to benefit from this. I'll now hand over to Bob to provide some more detail on the operational performance. Thanks, Jake, and, uh, good morning everyone. The December quarter saw our <inaudible> stabilize at 9.4. The highlight being a 35% reduction in the 12 month moving average at Mungari. The December quarter goal production is the first reported without Mount Carlton's contribution. The quarter's goal production was 148,000 ounces with a 5% improvement in the oil in sustaining cost to $1,347 an ounce. Despite the challenges faced with above average rainfall and COVID, Cowal had a strong quarter delivering 60,000 ounces at an all in sustaining cost of $998 an ounce. And an operating mine cashflow pre-capital of 80.6 million. Capital investment ramped up at Cowal with 60 million spent on major projects this quarter. This included 24 million on the IWL and 33.5 million on the underground development. Underground development rates will ramp up in the March quarter with a second jumbo commencing in December. And the selection of the primary mining contractor is on track for the March quarter. The project remains on budget and on schedule. The <inaudible> stage two deposition has run smoothly throughout the quarter. Ernest Henry produced 21,000 ounces of gold and 4. 1000 ounces of copper at an all in sustaining cost of a- $882 an ounce. The high IISC compared to the September quarter is primary driven, primarily driven by lower copper production due to a lower mining planned, uh, lower planned mining tons. The net mine cash remains strong at 79.5 million, another significant contribution to the portfolio. I'm pleased to say this will be the last quarter reporting Ernest Henry as an economic interest. Integration activities are well underway and I'm excited to have the Ernest Henry team as part of the Evolution family. The prefeasibility study for the mining extension below the 1125 RL has commenced and will incorporate the recent drilling results. Indicating mineralization extends further than assumed in the conce- concept study. Completion of the study is expected in H1 FY23. Moving on to Red Lake, over the past five months I've been on site three times. Each time I've seen improvement in step change in performance and devel- uh, and delivering. Although still work in progress, pleasingly, many key metrics are moving in the right direction. Red Lake produced 20,000 ounces for the quarter. And although the all in sustaining cost is not where we need it to be, the operating mine cash flow for the quarter was a positive. And with, and we've spent 13.9 million in sustaining capital and 36.9 million on major capital for future production. For the past couple of quarters, I've been talking about development. Pleasingly during the December quarter, each month was above our long, our, our long term transformation goal of 1200 meters per month. The December quarter was 21% higher than the September quarter. I expect this to continue allowing additional mining fronts to be opened. Campbell Mill continues to do, achieve new records and approval has been granted to lift the daily throughput restriction of 2000 tons per day for a limited trial in the second half of the financial year to support the Campbell Mill expansion. While still not where we want them to be, there's been significant improvements through the quarter. <inaudible> cycle time has improved by 25%. <inaudible> idle time has improved by 60%. Time to drill per <inaudible> has improved by 27%, and slot drilling has halved with a V30 implementation. <inaudible> extraction quality focused has delivered a 19% improvement in <inaudible> recovery, a 3% reduction in dilution and a 15% increase <inaudible> quarter and quarter. And in December, <inaudible> grade lifted to 4.9 grams per ton. Looking forward to H2, we are expecting, expecting to see a continually improvement in delivery from the underground and the two mills operating. Notable improvements for the second half of the year, our tons assessed will increase with the Red L- Red Lake mill running and the Campbell Mill <inaudible> extension. Grade mine, mind is lifting as dilution reduces and plans for early ore from the CYD development continue. Increased tons from <inaudible>. The transfer <inaudible> locomotion, the locomotives performance has improved by 43% last quarter, and replacement locomotives will be commissioned this quarter further reducing downtime. And increased number of mining ho- horizons in continuing the improvement in stoke design and execution to further enhance our all deliveries and quality. Mungari is moving forward post integration. Further quarter, they produced 34,000 ounces of gold at an all in sustaining cost of $1,829 an ounce, and generate an operating mine cashflow precapital of 20.7 million. All grade processed increased to 34% over the last quarter, as a proportion of underground ore and the feed increased from 54% to 67%. Workforce integration is ongoing with a focus on establishing a one team approach. The sharing of resources across the field has commenced and enabling better deployment of equipment and resources to priority areas, which has been a, been critical as a site navigates high vacancy rates and COVID related impacts. Mt. Rawdon produced 12,400 ounces at an only sustaining cost of $1,842 an ounce, and operating mice cash precapital of 11.9 million. As previously mentioned, weather significantly impacted access to the pit resulting in reduced all movements. As a result stock pile feed increased directly affecting gold grade and production. In summary, some great improvements from Red- Red Lake and Mungari throughout the quarter. The Cowal underground project continues to hit milestones and the official ownership of Ernest Henry mine has added additional opportunity for the portfolio. Thank you for your time and I'll hand over to Glen. Thank you, Bob. And good morning, everyone. Firstly, at our Q joint venture in Western Australia, we've advised our partner, Musgrave Minerals that we will be taking full management and operatorship at the project which occurred on January 1st of this year. Recent results from diamond drilling at the West Island prospect outlined on page 15 of this morning's report, importantly confirm the potential for high grade mineralization within individual loads. Drilling has also identified multiple new load structures in the favorable diorite host in various locations along strike. The geometric relationships between structures and diorite employee individual loads may be limited by their potential strike length that remain open at depth. The airport drilling program has been very important in further delineating the favorable diorite host and associated golden- golden nomism along strike from the original West Island drilling. The res- the results have unlocked new areas with the necessary geological ingredients. The mineralization to occur up to five kilometers from West Island. One of the challenges with all of our drilling programs is long delays waiting to receive assay result, results in time to inform where to drill next. This is an industry wide issue and is holding back the ability to accelerate drilling programs in the ways we would like to. At Q we are still waiting on results from five diamond holes and over 70 air core holes, which restricts our ability to sensibly add additional drilling resources. At Red Lake two deep holes were completed as wide space step outs from the original intercept reported last quarter on the ore zone extension. One of the holes intersected high grade mineralization 200 meters away from the first, from the first hole, with the other hole drilling through the structure. However, it did not return significant mineralization. The results reported on page 12 are encouraging because they'll unlock large area of real estate that has not been previously drilled along the extension of the ore zone structure. Follow up drilling is currently stepping off the high grade intercept in hole 69 to expand the potential scale of minimization in this area. At Mungari, drilling underground at Kundana and East Kundana continuous concentration on small resource extensions and classification upgrades on future mining areas adjacent to existing development. Step out drilling into the foot wall of the K2 structure from the underground at Hornet has returned further promising intercepts of stacked load style mineralization at <inaudible>. Follow up drilling is underway to understand the significance to eliminated vein in hole 2130 reported on page 14 of this morning's report. The geology is similar to what would be expected on the main cases structure at <inaudible>, which is where the priority follow up drilling. At Ernest Henry, we have assessed H2 drilling priorities, which will be focused on developing all body knowledge for the PFS along with de-risking areas of the resource that require additional data support before production is scheduled. As Bob and Jake mentioned earlier, strong copper gold mineralization has been intersected at the 480 meter RL and remains open down plunge. With that I'll hand over the Lawrie. Thank you, Glen, and good morning, everyone. This morning I'll provide a brief update on the financial performance for the quarter as outlined on pages nine and 10 of the report. The group, we produced 148,000 ounces at an all in sustaining cost of 1347 per ounce. This aligns without guidance where we said the production would increase over the year and the all in sustaining costs would trend down from around 1450 per ounce in the first quarter. The IISC was approximately 5% lower than the September quarter. Our focus on portfolio quality is evident in that on a light for light basis, the divestment of Mount Carlton operation reduced our all in sustaining cost by $28 per ounce this quarter. As our production in cost profile changes in the second half, the cost benefit from this divestment will improve further. Group production and cost guidance remain unchanged at 670 to 725,000 ounces at an all in sustaining cost of 1135 to 1195 per ounce. With the performance of Red Lake in the first half, we to be at the bottom end of the production range and between in the top half of the cost guidance range. In terms of cashflow, we were fairly well in line with plan, excluding the underperformance at Red Lake. We generated 203 million of operating cash flow, which is up 4.6% and 13% excluding Mount Carlton. On a per ounce basis, our operating cash flow was up 10% quarter on quarter. This was against a flat goal price and lower copper revenue where the higher copper price was offset by planned lower copper volumes at Ernest Henry. Net mine cash flow was 53 million with our capital programs remaining on plan. We invested around 34 million in sustaining capital, where major project investment increased to 114 million as projects in Cowal and at Cowal and Red Lake progressed. Group capital guidance remains unchanged at 150 to 175 million for sustaining, and 440 to 505 million for major projects. We'll see an immediate benefit of the acquisition of 100% of Ernest Henry, where IISC will reduce materially in the second half of the year. More importantly though, our cashflow will be increasing. Based on our guidance and depending on the copper price achieved in the second half, we expect to realize an additional 80 to 130 million of net mine cashflow at Ernest Henry. This will be taken into consideration when determining our interim dividend. As previously announced during the quarter, we successfully priced the US 200 million US private placement for nine years at very attractive pricing to partially fund the Ernest Henry acquisition. This will be drawn down next month. We ended December with 1.15 billion of cash and net debt of 450 million. Now our <inaudible> is around 12.6% prior to the payment for Ernest Henry in early January. We are on track to be below the 29% projector at time of announcing the acquisition, and we expect to quickly be back within our targeted gearing levels and maintain a very wrong balance sheet. I look forward to updating you next month on the FY22 interim financial results. Thank you for your time this morning. And Darcy, please open the line for questions. Thank you. If you wish to ask a question, please press star one on your telephone and wait for your name to be announced. If you wish to cancel your request, please press star two. Good, good morning, Jake team. So, uh, my question's on Red Lake. The, the commentary around mining rates does seem like, you know, more optimistic today, which is great, uh, especially with respect to, I guess, the mine efficiencies and dilution and, and opening up more mining freights up front. So just trying to think how we should think about, you know, the high development rates converting it to higher mine tons over sort of this year. And if you could maybe provide some sort of quantum how that comes through over the next c- couple of quarters. Uh, and then on grade, how we should sort of think about those numbers over the year. Obviously there's gonna be the sweetener from Campbell, but, you know, when do we from the, the operations today, how do we move closer to that reserve greater six, given that currently <inaudible>? Thanks, David. Uh, those are good questions. Um, I mean, I think we, you know, we are going through a transformation, you know, we've called it a three to five year transformation at Red Lake. Uh, the six months have taught us a lot about the operation. Uh, we've focused on the development and we've, we've specifically taken the decision to, I suppose, sacrifice production over development and getting ready and setting the tra- the transformation up. Bob, do you wanna add to that? Yeah. Thanks, uh, Jake. Uh, David, as Jake said, um, the expectation is that as we get the development in, uh, to the new areas and it takes a long time, uh, to, to go out and to open up new areas, then the mining front will open up, which will help stabilize and increase the, the tonnages. We've started to see an increase in tonnages last quarter through the quarter. Um, although it's not a- as high as we need it yet, but it's still it's growing. So Earl, the, the, just to clarify the study will be, um, delivered in the second half of this calendar year. So first half of FY23. results.withCtc: Thank you for standing by and welcome to the Evolution Mining December 2021 Quarter Results Call. All participants are in a listen-only mode. There will be a presentation followed by a question and answer session. If you wish to ask a question, you will need to press the star key followed by the number one on your telephone keypad. I would now like to hand the conference over to Mr. Martin Cummings, General Manager of Investor Relations. Please go ahead. Thank you, Darcy. Good morning and welcome to the Evolution Mining December 2021 Quarterly Conference Call. As Darcy mentioned, my name's Martin Cummings and I'm the General Manager Investor Relations. This morning on the call we have Jake Klein, our Executive Chairman, Laurie Conway, our CFO and Finance Director, and myself in our Group Office in Sydney. Bob Fulker, our Chief Chief Operating Officer, and Glenn Masterman, our VP Discovery and Business Development, are dialing in. It has been a tumultuous couple of years and has expected, gold's role as a safe haven during those times has been demonstrated. As the pandemic was breaking in early 2020, we saw gold rise from the low of fifteen hundreds per ounce to an all-time high around twenty seventy in August that year. We started twenty twenty one with the gold price down from its peak at just under US nineteen hundred per ounce.
